content:
# Master Resume System - Directus Schema Design

## Core Collections

### 1. **Identity** (Singleton)
Personal information and contact details

| Field | Type | Description |
|---

## Development & Knowledge Management

### 17. **Conversation Artifacts**
Store artifacts and decisions from development conversations

| Field | Type | Description |
|-------|------|-------------|
| id | Primary Key | Auto-generated |
| title | String | Artifact title/name |
| artifact_type | String | Schema Design, Feature Spec, API Design, etc. |
| content | Text (WYSIWYG) | Full artifact content (markdown/HTML) |
| conversation_date | Date | When this conversation occurred |
| conversation_context | Text | Brief context about what was being discussed |
| version | String | Version number (e.g., "1.0", "2.1") |
| status | String | Draft, Finalized, Implemented, Archived |
| tags | Tags | Categorization tags |
| related_collections | JSON | Which Directus collections this affects |
| key_decisions | Text | Major decisions made in this conversation |
| next_steps | Text | Action items or next development steps |
| participants | String | Who was involved (e.g., "Jay + Claude") |
| artifact_source | String | "Claude Conversation", "Manual Entry", etc. |
| implementation_notes | Text | Notes about actual implementation |
| created_by | Many-to-One | User who created this record | ??? directus_users |
| updated_at | DateTime | Last modification |

-------|------|-------------|
| id | Primary Key | Auto-generated |
| first_name | String | First name |
| last_name | String | Last name |
| email | Email | Primary email address |
| phone | String | Phone number |
| linkedin_url | URL | LinkedIn profile URL |
| website_url | URL | Personal website/portfolio URL |
| github_url | URL | GitHub profile (optional) |
| location | String | Current location/city |
| professional_summary | Text (Long) | Elevator pitch/professional summary |
| profile_photo | File | Headshot for resumes |

---

### 2. **Companies**
Organizations where you've worked

| Field | Type | Description | Relationships |
|-------|------|-------------|---------------|
| id | Primary Key | Auto-generated | |
| name | String | Company name | |
| industry | String | Industry/sector | |
| size | String | Company size (startup, mid-size, enterprise) | |
| location | String | Company location | |
| website | URL | Company website | |
| description | Text | Brief company description | |
| logo | File | Company logo | |

---

### 3. **Positions**
Roles held at companies

| Field | Type | Description | Relationships |
|-------|------|-------------|---------------|
| id | Primary Key | Auto-generated | |
| company | Many-to-One | Reference to company | ??? Companies |
| title | String | Job title | |
| department | String | Department/team | |
| start_date | Date | Start date | |
| end_date | Date | End date (null if current) | |
| is_current | Boolean | Currently in this role | |
| employment_type | String | Full-time, Contract, Part-time, etc. | |
| description | Text | Role overview/responsibilities | |

---

### 4. **Accomplishments**
Individual achievements and wins

| Field | Type | Description | Relationships |
|-------|------|-------------|---------------|
| id | Primary Key | Auto-generated | |
| position | Many-to-One | Associated position | ??? Positions |
| title | String | Brief accomplishment title | |
| description | Text (Long) | Detailed description | |
| impact_metrics | Text | Quantifiable results (revenue, %, etc.) | |
| technologies_used | Many-to-Many | Technologies involved | ??? Technologies |
| skills_demonstrated | Many-to-Many | Skills showcased | ??? Skills |
| accomplishment_type | String | Achievement, Project, Initiative, Award, etc. | |
| date_achieved | Date | When this was accomplished | |
| is_featured | Boolean | Highlight for key accomplishments | |
| evidence_links | JSON | Links to demos, articles, case studies | |

---

### 5. **Skills**
Technical and soft skills

| Field | Type | Description | Relationships |
|-------|------|-------------|---------------|
| id | Primary Key | Auto-generated | |
| name | String | Skill name | |
| category | String | Technical, Leadership, Design, etc. | |
| proficiency_level | Integer | 1-5 scale | |
| years_experience | Integer | Years working with this skill | |
| is_core_skill | Boolean | Primary/signature skill | |
| description | Text | Context about experience with skill | |

---

### 6. **Technologies**
Tools, platforms, frameworks, languages

| Field | Type | Description | Relationships |
|-------|------|-------------|---------------|
| id | Primary Key | Auto-generated | |
| name | String | Technology name | |
| category | String | Language, Framework, Tool, Platform | |
| proficiency_level | Integer | 1-5 scale | |
| years_experience | Integer | Years of experience | |
| last_used | Date | When last used professionally | |
| is_current | Boolean | Currently using | |
| icon | File | Technology logo/icon | |

---

### 7. **Projects**
Portfolio projects and case studies

| Field | Type | Description | Relationships |
|-------|------|-------------|---------------|
| id | Primary Key | Auto-generated | |
| position | Many-to-One | Associated position (optional) | ??? Positions |
| name | String | Project name | |
| description | Text (Long) | Project overview | |
| role | String | Your role in the project | |
| start_date | Date | Project start | |
| end_date | Date | Project completion | |
| technologies_used | Many-to-Many | Tech stack | ??? Technologies |
| skills_demonstrated | Many-to-Many | Skills showcased | ??? Skills |
| project_type | String | Product, Campaign, Internal Tool, etc. | |
| project_url | URL | Live project link | |
| github_url | URL | Code repository | |
| case_study_url | URL | Detailed case study | |
| images | Files | Screenshots, mockups | |
| is_featured | Boolean | Portfolio highlight | |

---

### 8. **Education**
Academic background

| Field | Type | Description | Relationships |
|-------|------|-------------|---------------|
| id | Primary Key | Auto-generated | |
| institution | String | School/university name | |
| degree_type | String | Bachelor's, Master's, Certificate, etc. | |
| field_of_study | String | Major/concentration | |
| graduation_date | Date | Graduation date | |
| gpa | Decimal | GPA (optional) | |
| honors | String | Honors, awards, distinctions | |
| relevant_coursework | Text | Key courses | |
| logo | File | Institution logo | |

---

### 9. **Certifications**
Professional certifications and licenses

| Field | Type | Description | Relationships |
|-------|------|-------------|---------------|
| id | Primary Key | Auto-generated | |
| name | String | Certification name | |
| issuing_organization | String | Certifying body | |
| issue_date | Date | Date received | |
| expiration_date | Date | Expiration (if applicable) | |
| credential_id | String | Certificate ID/number | |
| credential_url | URL | Verification link | |
| badge_image | File | Digital badge | |
| is_active | Boolean | Currently valid | |

---

### 10. **Job Applications**
Track applications and AI-generated resumes

| Field | Type | Description | Relationships |
|-------|------|-------------|---------------|
| id | Primary Key | Auto-generated | |
| company_name | String | Target company | |
| position_title | String | Role applied for | |
| job_description | Text (Long) | Full job posting | |
| application_date | Date | When applied | |
| application_status | String | Applied, Interview, Offer, Rejected, etc. | |
| generated_resume | File | AI-generated resume PDF | |
| cover_letter | Text (Long) | Generated cover letter | |
| selected_accomplishments | Many-to-Many | Accomplishments used | ??? Accomplishments |
| selected_skills | Many-to-Many | Skills highlighted | ??? Skills |
| selected_projects | Many-to-Many | Projects featured | ??? Projects |
| notes | Text | Application notes/feedback | |
| interview_dates | JSON | Interview schedule | |
| salary_range | String | Salary expectations/offer | |

---

### 16. **Blog Posts** (Optional)
Professional blog content

| Field | Type | Description | Relationships |
|-------|------|-------------|---------------|
| id | Primary Key | Auto-generated | |
| title | String | Post title | |
| slug | String | URL slug | |
| content | Text (WYSIWYG) | Post content | |
| excerpt | Text | Brief summary | |
| featured_image | File | Header image | |
| publish_date | DateTime | Publication date | |
| status | String | Draft, Published, Archived | |
| tags | Tags | Content tags | |
| related_skills | Many-to-Many | Skills discussed | ??? Skills |
| related_technologies | Many-to-Many | Technologies mentioned | ??? Technologies |
| seo_title | String | SEO title | |
| seo_description | String | Meta description | |

---

## Key Relationships Summary

### Core Data Flow
- **Companies** ??? **Positions** ??? **Accomplishments**
- **Position Titles** ??? **Positions** (Multiple titles per position)
- **Professional Summaries** (Multiple summaries for different contexts)
- **Accomplishment Variations** ??? **Accomplishments** (Multiple ways to phrase accomplishments)

### Cross-References
- **Projects** ??? **Positions** (Many-to-Many - projects can span multiple roles)
- **Projects** ??? **Companies** (Many-to-Many - projects can involve multiple companies)
- **Projects** ??? **Accomplishments** (Many-to-Many - projects can relate to multiple accomplishments)
- **Accomplishments** ??? **Skills** (Many-to-Many)
- **Accomplishments** ??? **Technologies** (Many-to-Many)
- **Projects** ??? **Skills** (Many-to-Many)
- **Projects** ??? **Technologies** (Many-to-Many)

### Cover Letter Generation Junction Tables (with AI reasoning)

#### Cover Letters ??? Professional Summaries
| Field | Type | Description |
|-------|------|-------------|
| cover_letter_id | Foreign Key | Reference to cover letter |
| professional_summary_id | Foreign Key | Reference to summary |
| ai_reasoning | Text | Why this summary was selected |
| job_description_reference | Text | Specific parts of job description this addresses |

#### Cover Letters ??? Accomplishments
| Field | Type | Description |
|-------|------|-------------|
| cover_letter_id | Foreign Key | Reference to cover letter |
| accomplishment_id | Foreign Key | Reference to accomplishment |
| ai_reasoning | Text | Why this accomplishment was selected |
| job_description_reference | Text | Specific requirements this accomplishment demonstrates |
| cover_letter_section | String | Where used (opening, body paragraph 1, body paragraph 2, closing) |

#### Cover Letters ??? Projects
| Field | Type | Description |
|-------|------|-------------|
| cover_letter_id | Foreign Key | Reference to cover letter |
| project_id | Foreign Key | Reference to project |
| ai_reasoning | Text | Why this project was selected |
| job_description_reference | Text | Specific requirements this project showcases |
| cover_letter_section | String | Where used in the cover letter |

#### Cover Letters ??? Skills
| Field | Type | Description |
|-------|------|-------------|
| cover_letter_id | Foreign Key | Reference to cover letter |
| skill_id | Foreign Key | Reference to skill |
| ai_reasoning | Text | Why this skill was selected |
| job_description_reference | Text | Specific job requirements this skill matches |
| cover_letter_section | String | Where mentioned in the cover letter |

#### Cover Letters ??? Technologies
| Field | Type | Description |
|-------|------|-------------|
| cover_letter_id | Foreign Key | Reference to cover letter |
| technology_id | Foreign Key | Reference to technology |
| ai_reasoning | Text | Why this technology was selected |
| job_description_reference | Text | Specific tech requirements this addresses |
| cover_letter_section | String | Where mentioned in the cover letter |

#### Cover Letters ??? Companies (Previous Experience)
| Field | Type | Description |
|-------|------|-------------|
| cover_letter_id | Foreign Key | Reference to cover letter |
| company_id | Foreign Key | Reference to company |
| ai_reasoning | Text | Why this company experience was highlighted |
| job_description_reference | Text | How this experience relates to requirements |
| cover_letter_section | String | Where mentioned in the cover letter |

---

## Cover Letter AI Generation Flow

### 1. **Opening Strategy Selection**
- Analyze company culture and role requirements
- Choose appropriate tone (formal, conversational, innovative)
- Select hook approach (shared connection, company admiration, relevant news, direct value proposition)

### 2. **Content Structure Planning**
- **Paragraph 1**: Opening hook + role interest + key value proposition
- **Paragraph 2**: Most relevant accomplishment with specific metrics
- **Paragraph 3**: Secondary accomplishment or project that demonstrates fit
- **Paragraph 4**: Skills/technologies that directly match requirements
- **Paragraph 5**: Company-specific interest and cultural fit
- **Closing**: Call to action and professional sign-off

### 3. **Intelligent Content Selection**
- **Accomplishments**: Choose 2-3 most relevant with quantifiable results
- **Projects**: Select 1-2 that best demonstrate required capabilities
- **Skills**: Highlight those explicitly mentioned in job description
- **Technologies**: Include tech stack matches
- **Company Experience**: Reference relevant industry/company size experience

### 4. **Personalization Elements**
- **Company Research**: Reference recent news, mission, values, or initiatives
- **Role Specifics**: Address specific challenges mentioned in job description
- **Cultural Fit**: Demonstrate understanding of company culture
- **Growth Story**: Show career progression relevant to this opportunity

### 5. **Tone and Voice Adaptation**
- **Startup**: Agile, innovative, adaptable language
- **Enterprise**: Professional, structured, process-oriented
- **Creative**: Passionate, vision-driven, collaborative
- **Technical**: Precise, methodology-focused, results-driven

---
- **Resumes** ??? **Professional Summaries** (Which summary to use)
- **Resumes** ??? **Skills** (Which skills to feature)
- **Resumes** ??? **Technologies** (Which technologies to highlight)
- **Resumes** ??? **Accomplishments** (Which accomplishments to include)
- **Resumes** ??? **Projects** (Which projects to showcase)
- **Resumes** ??? **Education** (Which education to include)
- **Resumes** ??? **Certifications** (Which certifications to feature)
- **Resumes** ??? **Resumes** (Parent-child for versioning)

### Application Tracking
- **Job Applications** ??? **Resumes** (Which resume was used)
- **Job Applications** ??? **Cover Letters** (Which cover letter was used)
- **Cover Letters** ??? **Accomplishments** (Referenced accomplishments)
- **Cover Letters** ??? **Projects** (Referenced projects)

## AI Integration Points

1. **Resume Generation**: 
   - Analyze job description to select appropriate Professional Summaries (multiple)
   - Blend selected summaries into cohesive, polished result
   - Choose relevant Accomplishments (and their best variations)
   - Select Position Titles that match the role
   - Pick Skills and Technologies that align with requirements
   - Generate full HTML resume stored in Resumes collection

2. **Virtual Interview**: 
   - Query all collections to provide contextual answers
   - Reference specific accomplishments and projects
   - Adapt language based on accomplishment variations

3. **Application Tracking**: 
   - Store complete resume snapshots (HTML) so they remain static
   - Track which combinations work best for different role types
   - Version control for iterative improvements

4. **Content Arsenal**:
   - Multiple professional summaries for different industries
   - Position title variations for different contexts
   - Accomplishment variations for different tones/audiences
conversation_context: Initial design session for Master Resume System database schema. Discussed AI-powered resume generation, content variations, and intelligent selection tracking.
implementation_notes: Schema designed to support AI-powered resume generation with full transparency into AI decision-making process. Focus on content reusability and tracking effectiveness.
key_decisions:
- Separated resumes/cover letters from job applications for better tracking
- Added junction tables with AI reasoning fields
- Created content variation system (multiple summaries, titles, accomplishment versions)
- Implemented many-to-many relationships for professional summaries in resumes
- Added version control with parent-child relationships
next_steps:
1. Create Identity singleton collection
2. Build Professional Summaries collection
3. Create Companies and Positions collections
4. Implement Skills and Technologies collections
5. Set up accomplishments with variations
6. Build resume generation system
title: Master Resume System - Database Schema Design

content:
Master Resume System - Implementation Next Steps

Complete roadmap for implementing relationships, junction tables, and AI integration for the Master Resume System.

Phase 1: Core Relationships (Manual Implementation Required)

1.1 Basic Many-to-One Relationships

These need to be created manually in Directus admin:

CollectionFieldRelated CollectionDescription
positionscompanycompaniesLink position to company
accomplishmentspositionpositionsLink accomplishment to position
accomplishment_variationsaccomplishmentaccomplishmentsLink variation to main accomplishment
resumesparent_resumeresumesVersion control - link to previous version
cover_lettersparent_cover_lettercover_lettersVersion control for cover letters
job_applicationsresume_usedresumesWhich resume was submitted
job_applicationscover_letter_usedcover_lettersWhich cover letter was submitted

1.2 Junction Tables for Many-to-Many Relationships

Create these collections manually with the specified fields:

accomplishments_skills

FieldTypeInterface
accomplishment_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? accomplishments
skill_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? skills

accomplishments_technologies

FieldTypeInterface
accomplishment_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? accomplishments
technology_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? technologies

accomplishments_projects

FieldTypeInterface
accomplishment_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? accomplishments
project_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? projects

projects_skills

FieldTypeInterface
project_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? projects
skill_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? skills

projects_technologies

FieldTypeInterface
project_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? projects
technology_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? technologies

projects_positions

FieldTypeInterface
project_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? projects
position_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? positions

projects_companies

FieldTypeInterface
project_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? projects
company_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? companies

Phase 2: Resume Generation Junction Tables (AI Decision Tracking)

2.1 Resume Selection Tracking

These tables track what the AI selected and why:

resumes_professional_summaries

FieldTypeInterfaceDescription
resume_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? resumesReference to resume
professional_summary_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? professional_summariesReference to summary
ai_reasoningTextMultiline InputWhy this summary was selected
job_description_referenceTextMultiline InputSpecific parts of job description this addresses

resumes_skills

FieldTypeInterfaceDescription
resume_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? resumesReference to resume
skill_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? skillsReference to skill
ai_reasoningTextMultiline InputWhy this skill was selected
job_description_referenceTextMultiline InputSpecific job requirements this skill matches

resumes_technologies

FieldTypeInterfaceDescription
resume_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? resumesReference to resume
technology_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? technologiesReference to technology
ai_reasoningTextMultiline InputWhy this technology was selected
job_description_referenceTextMultiline InputSpecific tech requirements this addresses

resumes_accomplishments

FieldTypeInterfaceDescription
resume_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? resumesReference to resume
accomplishment_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? accomplishmentsReference to accomplishment
ai_reasoningTextMultiline InputWhy this accomplishment was selected
job_description_referenceTextMultiline InputSpecific requirements this accomplishment demonstrates

resumes_projects

FieldTypeInterfaceDescription
resume_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? resumesReference to resume
project_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? projectsReference to project
ai_reasoningTextMultiline InputWhy this project was selected
job_description_referenceTextMultiline InputSpecific requirements this project showcases

resumes_education

FieldTypeInterfaceDescription
resume_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? resumesReference to resume
education_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? educationReference to education
ai_reasoningTextMultiline InputWhy this education was included
job_description_referenceTextMultiline InputEducation requirements this addresses

resumes_certifications

FieldTypeInterfaceDescription
resume_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? resumesReference to resume
certification_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? certificationsReference to certification
ai_reasoningTextMultiline InputWhy this certification was included
job_description_referenceTextMultiline InputCertification requirements this addresses

Phase 3: Cover Letter Collections & Relationships

3.1 Create Cover Letters Collection

Add these fields to the existing cover_letters collection:

FieldTypeInterfaceDescription
titleStringInputCover letter name/version
contentTextWYSIWYGFull HTML cover letter content
target_roleStringInputRole this targets
target_companyStringInputCompany this targets
version_numberIntegerInputVersion tracking
generated_by_aiBooleanBooleanAI-generated vs manual
ai_promptTextMultilinePrompt used for generation

3.2 Cover Letter Junction Tables

cover_letters_accomplishments

FieldTypeInterfaceDescription
cover_letter_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? cover_lettersReference to cover letter
accomplishment_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? accomplishmentsReference to accomplishment
ai_reasoningTextMultiline InputWhy this accomplishment was selected
job_description_referenceTextMultiline InputSpecific requirements this demonstrates
cover_letter_sectionStringSelect DropdownWhere used (opening, body paragraph 1, body paragraph 2, closing)

cover_letters_projects

FieldTypeInterfaceDescription
cover_letter_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? cover_lettersReference to cover letter
project_idMany-to-OneSelect Dropdown M2O ??? projectsReference to project
ai_reasoningTextMultiline InputWhy this project was selected
job_description_referenceTextMultiline InputSpecific requirements this showcases
cover_letter_sectionStringSelect DropdownWhere used in the cover letter

Phase 4: Data Entry Strategy

4.1 Recommended Order

  1. Identity - Add your personal information
  2. Companies - Add all companies you've worked for
  3. Positions - Link positions to companies
  4. Skills & Technologies - Build your expertise inventory
  5. Professional Summaries - Create 3-5 targeted summaries
  6. Accomplishments - Document all achievements
  7. Accomplishment Variations - Create alternative phrasings
  8. Projects - Add portfolio projects
  9. Education & Certifications - Academic and professional credentials

4.2 Content Strategy

  • Professional Summaries: Create variations for AI-focused, electronics, marketing, leadership, startup contexts
  • Accomplishments: Document 50+ achievements with quantifiable metrics
  • Accomplishment Variations: Create technical, executive, and general versions of key accomplishments
  • Skills Categorization: Organize by Technical, Leadership, Communication, Business, Analytics
  • Technology Tracking: Include proficiency levels and last used dates

Phase 5: AI Integration Architecture

5.1 MCP/LlamaIndex Integration Points

  • Resume Generation API: Query Directus for relevant content based on job description
  • Content Selection Logic: AI analyzes job requirements and selects appropriate accomplishments, skills, summaries
  • Junction Table Population: AI records reasoning for each selection in junction tables
  • Version Control: Track parent-child relationships for resume iterations

5.2 Virtual Interview System

  • Query Engine: LlamaIndex/LangChain queries across all collections
  • Context Building: Combine accomplishments, projects, skills for comprehensive answers
  • Response Personalization: Use actual experience data to generate authentic responses

Phase 6: Testing & Optimization

6.1 Data Validation

  • Ensure all relationships are properly connected
  • Test junction table queries
  • Validate AI reasoning field population

6.2 Performance Optimization

  • Index frequently queried fields
  • Optimize relationship queries
  • Test AI generation speed

Success Metrics

  • Content Completeness: 50+ accomplishments, 20+ skills, 10+ technologies documented
  • Variation Coverage: 3+ professional summaries, 2+ accomplishment variations per key achievement
  • AI Transparency: 100% of AI selections include reasoning and job description references
  • Application Tracking: Complete audit trail from job description to submitted resume
conversation_context: Documentation of next steps after creating all core collections for the Master Resume System. Comprehensive guide for implementing relationships, junction tables, and AI integration.
implementation_notes: This document provides the complete roadmap for taking the Master Resume System from basic collections to a fully functional AI-powered resume generation platform. Follow phases sequentially for best results.
key_decisions:
- Manual relationship creation required due to API limitations
- Junction tables will track AI decision reasoning
- Phased implementation approach for manageable complexity
- Content-first strategy before AI integration
- Comprehensive tracking for optimization and learning
next_steps:
1. Create all relationship fields manually in Directus admin
2. Build junction tables for many-to-many relationships
3. Start data entry with core collections (Identity, Companies, Positions)
4. Build content library (Skills, Accomplishments, Professional Summaries)
5. Implement AI integration for resume generation
6. Create virtual interview system
7. Test and optimize system performance
title: Master Resume System - Implementation Next Steps & Relationships

content:
Many-to-Many Fields Quick Reference

Simple guide for creating M2M fields - Directus creates junction tables automatically

Phase 1: Core M2M Relationships

1. Start with: accomplishments

  • Field Name: skills
    • Type: Many-to-Many (M2M)
    • Interface: List M2M
    • Related Collection: skills
    • Junction Table: accomplishments_skills (auto-created)
  • Field Name: technologies
    • Type: Many-to-Many (M2M)
    • Interface: List M2M
    • Related Collection: technologies
    • Junction Table: accomplishments_technologies (auto-created)
  • Field Name: projects
    • Type: Many-to-Many (M2M)
    • Interface: List M2M
    • Related Collection: projects
    • Junction Table: accomplishments_projects (auto-created)

2. Start with: projects

  • Field Name: skills
    • Type: Many-to-Many (M2M)
    • Interface: List M2M
    • Related Collection: skills
    • Junction Table: projects_skills (auto-created)
  • Field Name: technologies
    • Type: Many-to-Many (M2M)
    • Interface: List M2M
    • Related Collection: technologies
    • Junction Table: projects_technologies (auto-created)
  • Field Name: positions
    • Type: Many-to-Many (M2M)
    • Interface: List M2M
    • Related Collection: positions
    • Junction Table: projects_positions (auto-created)
  • Field Name: companies
    • Type: Many-to-Many (M2M)
    • Interface: List M2M
    • Related Collection: companies
    • Junction Table: projects_companies (auto-created)

Phase 2: AI Resume Generation M2M (Advanced)

Note: These need custom junction tables with ai_reasoning fields. Create these manually after Phase 1.

3. Start with: resumes

  • Field Name: professional_summaries_used
    • Type: Many-to-Many (M2M)
    • Interface: List M2M
    • Related Collection: professional_summaries
    • Junction Table: resumes_professional_summaries
    • Custom Fields Needed: ai_reasoning, job_description_reference
  • Field Name: skills_included
    • Type: Many-to-Many (M2M)
    • Interface: List M2M
    • Related Collection: skills
    • Junction Table: resumes_skills
    • Custom Fields Needed: ai_reasoning, job_description_reference
  • Field Name: technologies_included
    • Type: Many-to-Many (M2M)
    • Interface: List M2M
    • Related Collection: technologies
    • Junction Table: resumes_technologies
    • Custom Fields Needed: ai_reasoning, job_description_reference
  • Field Name: accomplishments_included
    • Type: Many-to-Many (M2M)
    • Interface: List M2M
    • Related Collection: accomplishments
    • Junction Table: resumes_accomplishments
    • Custom Fields Needed: ai_reasoning, job_description_reference
  • Field Name: projects_included
    • Type: Many-to-Many (M2M)
    • Interface: List M2M
    • Related Collection: projects
    • Junction Table: resumes_projects
    • Custom Fields Needed: ai_reasoning, job_description_reference
  • Field Name: education_included
    • Type: Many-to-Many (M2M)
    • Interface: List M2M
    • Related Collection: education
    • Junction Table: resumes_education
    • Custom Fields Needed: ai_reasoning, job_description_reference
  • Field Name: certifications_included
    • Type: Many-to-Many (M2M)
    • Interface: List M2M
    • Related Collection: certifications
    • Junction Table: resumes_certifications
    • Custom Fields Needed: ai_reasoning, job_description_reference

Basic M2O Relationships (Create First)

4. Start with: positions

  • Field Name: company
    • Type: Many-to-One (M2O)
    • Interface: Select Dropdown M2O
    • Related Collection: companies

5. Start with: accomplishments

  • Field Name: position
    • Type: Many-to-One (M2O)
    • Interface: Select Dropdown M2O
    • Related Collection: positions

6. Start with: accomplishment_variations

  • Field Name: accomplishment
    • Type: Many-to-One (M2O)
    • Interface: Select Dropdown M2O
    • Related Collection: accomplishments

7. Start with: job_applications

  • Field Name: resume_used
    • Type: Many-to-One (M2O)
    • Interface: Select Dropdown M2O
    • Related Collection: resumes
  • Field Name: cover_letter_used
    • Type: Many-to-One (M2O)
    • Interface: Select Dropdown M2O
    • Related Collection: cover_letters

8. Start with: resumes

  • Field Name: parent_resume
    • Type: Many-to-One (M2O)
    • Interface: Select Dropdown M2O
    • Related Collection: resumes
    • Note: For version control

Directus UI Steps:

  1. Go to Collection: [Start with collection name above]
  2. Settings ??? Data Model ??? [Collection] ??? Add Field
  3. Field Name: [Use exact name from above]
  4. Type: Many-to-Many or Many-to-One
  5. Interface: List M2M or Select Dropdown M2O
  6. Related Collection: [Target collection]
  7. Save Field

Important Notes:

  • Phase 1 First: Create basic M2O relationships before M2M
  • Auto Junction Tables: Directus creates junction tables automatically for Phase 1
  • Phase 2 Advanced: For AI tracking, you'll need to manually add ai_reasoning fields to the auto-created junction tables later
  • Order Matters: Create M2O relationships first, then M2M relationships

Quick Checklist:

??? M2O Relationships (Do First):

  • positions.company ??? companies
  • accomplishments.position ??? positions
  • accomplishment_variations.accomplishment ??? accomplishments
  • job_applications.resume_used ??? resumes
  • job_applications.cover_letter_used ??? cover_letters
  • resumes.parent_resume ??? resumes

??? M2M Relationships (Do Second):

  • accomplishments.skills ??? skills
  • accomplishments.technologies ??? technologies
  • accomplishments.projects ??? projects
  • projects.skills ??? skills
  • projects.technologies ??? technologies
  • projects.positions ??? positions
  • projects.companies ??? companies

???? Advanced M2M (Do Later):

  • resumes.professional_summaries_used ??? professional_summaries
  • resumes.skills_included ??? skills
  • resumes.technologies_included ??? technologies
  • resumes.accomplishments_included ??? accomplishments
  • resumes.projects_included ??? projects
  • resumes.education_included ??? education
  • resumes.certifications_included ??? certifications
conversation_context: Quick reference guide for creating junction tables in Directus UI, extracted from the comprehensive implementation documentation.
implementation_notes: This approach leverages Directus auto-creation of junction tables for basic relationships, with manual customization only needed for AI tracking fields. Much simpler than creating all junction tables manually.
key_decisions:
- Let Directus auto-create junction tables for basic M2M relationships
- Create M2O relationships first, then M2M relationships
- Advanced AI tracking fields need to be added manually to auto-created junction tables
- Separated into phases for logical implementation order
next_steps:
1. Create all M2O relationships first
2. Create basic M2M relationships (Phase 1)
3. Test data entry and relationship functionality
4. Add AI tracking fields to junction tables manually (Phase 2)
5. Create advanced resume M2M relationships
title: M2M Fields Quick Reference - Let Directus Handle Junction Tables
